adr_address: Via Moneta, 1, 20123 Milano MI, Italy

editorial_summary.overview: Elegant hotel in an 1800s building with frescoes, offering classic rooms & a bar.

name: Hotel Gran Duca di York

plus_code.compound_code: F57P+F4 Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text: I don’t understand how this is only a 3 star hotel. I have holidayed in Europe countless times and this has been one of the ovwrall most lovely hotels I have ever stayed in. It has old world charm, the staff were incredibly helpful arranging our taxis, helping me arrange a parcel delivery and even offering to put our luggage in the car, they have a plethora of free snacks in the foyer and a fully stocked hotel room fridge in each room with all non alcoholic beverages for free as well as a large vegan slab of excellent quality chocolate. They had an excellent breakfast buffet with some vegan options which I was very happy about. Our room was pristine and the bathroom had every amenity you can think of. I noticed they way the staff interacted with other guests as well being universally kind and helpful. I consider myself someone who is not easily pleased and this hotel genuinely exceeded every expectation. The people who work there can be incredibly proud of themselves and I trust the management values them.

This place is AMAZING! My husband and I stayed here for our 10 year anniversary,  and we can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. The hotel is beautiful, the breakfast is amazing, and the location is PERFECT (less than a 5 minute walk to the Duomo and shopping, and less than a 20 minute walk to the Last Supper). There are complimentary drinks in your room daily and there are evening snacks for hotel guests. Now for the staff members....BEST hotel staff EVER! They were so dang kind and helpful. We had the pleasure of being helped by the hotel staff in the morning and evening, and also the night bar tender. We loved them and we will stay here again mostly because of their kindness. As amazing as the hotel is, they are what set it so far apart from other hotels!

Excellent location, within walking distance of the Duomo. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. There were a couple of good surprises: welcome drinks downstairs, and all non-alcoholic drinks in the mini-bar were free.
On top of that, there were always pastries, candy and bottled water available at the lobby.
The room was not big, but comfortable, well furnished and quiet.
The breakfast was excellent with many options.
The bathroom could have been better: the shower area was very small.  The shower head was splashing all over, and the toilet was leaking inside, wasting water. I reported the issue, they brought someone to fix, but it was not fixed.

We had a fantastic stay at Hotel Gran Duca Di York. The location is perfect—quiet, but just a short walk to all the main sights. The hotel is full of charm, the rooms are spotless and very comfortable, and the breakfast was fresh and delicious every morning. But the highlight for us were the  staff who were so friendly and always happy to help. Everything about our stay was excellent. Highly recommend!

I chose this hotel because of its walkable location from the Metro, away from tourist crowds, but not too far that I couldn't walk to the Duomo and restaurants. Also, as a solo woman traveler, I needed a location with staff on site 24/7. I also checked multiple review sites, mapped the location, and viewed photos. I checked to make sure all reviews were within 6 months, versus 6 years ago. (I noticed that many hotels in Italy have no recent reviews.) This hotel met my vital needs.

The extras were the friendly faces that greeted me at the desk upon arrival, the happy hour barista in the hotel that serves complimentary cocktails, Italian wine, cappuccinos and espressos. English is understood and spoken, which if this is your first time to Italy, like it was for me, it was helpful. There is an elevator, which is nice to have in Italy. The other hotel guests I met were all friendly to me also. The hotel is peaceful and quiet. I was there in July, which is the most insanely busy time to travel to Italy. So having a quiet, gentle hotel which you can return to after a busy, intense day in Milan is a MUST for a traveler like me.

The hotel is a step above basic, and its very clean, neat and attended to. You can tell the hotel is loved. I would say from my experience with hotels, it's a 2.5 to 3-star hotel in Milan. The helpful and friendly staff will call a taxi for you, provide umbrellas, and share their recommendations on restaurants and directions, and will make reservations for you, as needed. I noticed mostly couples there, slightly older which I prefer as a solo woman traveler.

Room
My room was a single and faced the interior garden, which was lovely. The single room is small and tight. The windows fully open, and have wood blinds if you'd like to keep the fresh outside air coming through the room. I loved mine because the night I stayed there, there was a beautiful Italian thunderstorm that I loved listening to in my room.

Bathroom
The bathroom was clean and tiny--typical of Europe. Fresh towels, soap and shampoo is provided. Availability of shampoo, conditioner and lotion is not always a guarantee in European hotels, shower gel (which I don't prefer) seems to be the norm, so always check first. I always bring my own body lotion and hair products, I have very dry skin and natural hair.

I recommend Hotel Gran Duca di York without reservations. Try to get a room that faces the inset garden.
